task.title: Adding contacts to your contact list
task.shortdesc: The contact list is a list of people with whom you frequently chat. A contact is someone you added to one or more of your groups. When you are online, by default only contacts that are also online are visible.

context.p: After you add a contact, you can start a chat with the contact or display information about the contact without searching the directory.

You can add someone who is in your organization or from another organization. You can invite a user from another organization to your network. After that person accepts your invitation, you can add them to your contact list.
Contacts can be placed in groups allowing you to chat and send messages to all group members at one time. Individuals can be members of multiple groups.

Each contact is assigned a grey icon based on the following order:
Photo from the person's business card ID
Initials of the person
Default icon containing a graphic

step.cmd: Click the menu icon ( ) in the navigator and select Contacts.

step.info: The New Contact window opens, you must first select a group to which the contact is added. If there is no available group, click Create a New Group.

step.cmd: In the Search for contacts field, begin typing the name of the person you want to add, as you type suggestions are provided. When the name that you want to add displays, click the name.
step.info: Multiple names can be added to the group at the same time, click Add Another Contact to add more contacts to the group.

step.cmd: When you are finished adding contacts, click Add.
step.info: Expand the group name and the new contacts are listed.
